data.title: Good Location
data.text: This hotel is in a good location for activities in College Station. It is a mid price hotel and the amenities reflect this. The continental breakfast was just so-so. When we arrived we had booked a non smoking room with 2 double beds and the room they assigned us was a king smoking room. The staff was able to correct this but it was an inconvenience.

data.title: Fine hotel for football weekend
data.text: The hotel staff was friendly and helpful. The room was clean and beds comfortable but no frills. It's about a 30 minute walk to Kyle Field. We were there for a football game and campus visit, and this was the best value in town, across the street from campus and close walk to restaurants. The price was higher than I would normally pay for this type of hotel, but I imagine that's because it was a football home-game weekend.

data.title: Don't stay here for game day!
data.text: This place should be leveled.  Just gross.  Overall poor condition MOTEL, not hotel.  Beer tabs on the floor, hair in the bathroom, greasy tub, dirty corners.  Reached behind the nightstand to plug in phone charger and it was DISGUSTING.  Don't stay.  La Quinta should rid themselves of this property.

data.title: Ok, I guess
data.text: The front staff were very nice.  There was parking in front of the room.  However, the room itself was not very good.  The tub was dirty, 2 of the lights did not work and there were no "extra" outlets.  I had to unplug a lamp to use that outlet.  The hotel just needs to be upgraded and cleaning staff needs to be shown the difference between clean and dirty.

data.title: Better than expected
data.text: I was concerned because the reviews said this was not a clean place to stay and that the rooms were smelly. I booked two rooms and neither were smelly.  The rooms were clean and comfortable.  I was planning on asking for a different room it I was not satisfied but it did not come to that and we were happy with our rooms.  The continental breakfast was a standard type of breakfast with cereal, bread, a waffle maker, juices, coffee, and fresh fruit, yogurt, etc.   I especially chose this hotel because they do not charge extra for pets.

data.title: La Quinta College Station
data.text: The hotel is definitely in need of an update.  BUT the staff is very friendly, responsive and is one of the few pet friendly hotels in the area.  The rooms are clean considering the age of the fixtures and the cleaning staff did a good job in getting the room ready for us early so we could attend our event.  I would stay there again if visiting the area.

data.title: Close to Campus - Good for gameday.
data.text: If you're looking for a place to crash after being outside in the heat all day after the game, this is the place.  That's really about it.  It's close to campus - you can walk it, and pretty central to everything you'll need in College Station (you are on a main street, so traffic can be bad - use the neighborhood roads to get out of it if you can), but other than that, this is just a La Quinta.    I will say it's usually cleaner than the run of the mill motels, but it's still just a La Quinta.    If you're in College Station for the week and need a budget place to stay - this is probably one of the best. It's nothing special - but it'll do.   Good location. Not scary.  In a safe area of town.  Gamedays / weekends they do price gauge - but so does everyone else.    For busy weekends / games / events - GET THERE EARLY!!  Parking can be a little tricky, and they do overbook.

data.title: Overall Opinon
data.text: Breakfast should have had more choices, such as eggs and sausage not just waffles, pastries and fruit.   Bed was comfortable really comfortable and room stayed extremely cool! Which was perfect.   Bathroom area could use a little work, base boards cleaned, work on drainage in tub and the discoloration on tub where you stand.

data.title: Great Location
data.text: Good hotel. Nice staff. Good breakfast. Just really needs to be updated!! Carpet is old and furniture is very dated. It is in a good location to walk to Northgate and campus and close to several restaurants.

data.title: Pet Friendly/Wow!
data.text: It was wonderful to have a hotel welcome our little dogs.  The best part is, "NO EXTRA CHARGE"!  The staff was friendly and helpful when needed.  Hope they are like this all over the US.  We will definitely stay with LaQuinta again when the need arises.  Thanks for everything.

data.title: Outdated, unprepared, smelly
data.text:
Unfortunately, because of some convention happening in College Station I wasn't able to find a room in any of the business-type hotels and had to take a room at the La Quinta Inn.
My room wasn't ready when I arrived at 10pm although I had made my reservation with sufficient time in advance.  The room that I was finally had a very strong smell of mold/dampness.  Amenities were bare-bones, and the room quality was very low, with stained carpets, stained ceilings, and furniture showing cigarette burns.
I was given a different room the next day.  The odor wasn't as strong, but the room's condition was equally bad.
I'm giving it two stars, because it's a place that I was nevertheless willing to sleep in, but I would not go there again if any of the better-class hotel's is available.

owner_response.author: LQ0539GM, Manager at La Quinta Inn College Station, responded to this review
owner_response.text: First, I would like to thank you for taking the time to leave a review. This is definitely not the kind of experience we want our guests to have. I would like to apologize for the issues you encountered and I will be speaking to our Front Desk and housekeeping staff about your concerns.  I also will be speaking with our Maintenance supervisor about going through the rooms and checking for dampness and odors so we can hopefully stop these problems from happening in the future.  Chris AGM
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: The M and M and the spoon
data.text:
Staff was great. Very professional and accommodating. 
However, housekeeping is substandard and lacking.   I stayed there for 3 weeks and didnt get housekeeping everyday. Usually every 3 days for some reason.  Behind the recliner was an M and M and a plastic spoon. In plain view. They were there when I moved in and still there when I moved out.
Got covered in bug bites. Not sure if bedbugs or something else but without a doubt.....they are bugbites.
Rooms are worn and need remodeling.
On the days housekeeping did come by it was an obvious rush job. Bed sloppily made. No soap , shampoo refills. The M and M and spoon were always overlooked.
There is a lot of late nite traffic in and out of neighboring rooms and some rooms had multiple people. 4 or 5 in a room. ( workers )
I wont stay there again.

owner_response.author: LQ0539GM, General Manager at La Quinta Inn College Station, responded to this review
owner_response.text: This is definitely not the kind of experience we want our guests to have. I'm so sorry about the issues you encountered and I will speak with my staff about your concerns. I hope you will visit us again in the future and it will be a more memorable stay. Again thank you for your review. Chris A. AGM
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Home Away from Home
data.text: Very accomadating to us and help us in any way they can.  They all know us well as we have booked our special room for all The Texas A & M home football games as well as my daughter stays there on the days she is teaching down there at A & m.  We love LaQuinta and especially this one.

data.title: la quinta college station  - sub quality
data.text: It was easy to set up reservations the same day that we needed a room.    Fast and easy check in and the staff seemed very  nice. We were unaware this was an older hotel, but since we would only be there for one night I thought ok we will go ahead and stay here .     You enter your room from the outside and park your car in front of the door. There were two men who had pulled the chairs out of there room to smoke outside on the sidewalk, they looked like loiterers which made me feel uneasy.      Our  first room looked ok when we went in. We had problems though, when turning on the lamps,  three of the four lamps that provided light, wouldn't work.        Husband took the bulbs out of the lamps and moved them around to the other lamps and still no lights.    Hotel staff moved us to another room. The next room  looked ok, decent sheets but surely not a quality mattress. I walked over to the air conditioning unit to check the temperature and the carpet was soggy wet.  That did it for me, ready to leave ..We were here one hour from check in to check out.     This hotel needs major maintenance and I hope they can take care of their issues.

owner_response.author: LQ0539GM, Manager at La Quinta Inn College Station, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for taking the time to leave a review of our property. First I would like to apologize about the issues you encountered. This is definitely not the kind of experience we want our guests to have and I will speak with our staff about them.  Again thank you for your review. Chris A. AGM
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: 10 Minutes away from everything
data.text: Let's be honest.  This hotel is one of the older facilities in College Station.  But, any physical features I sometimes find frustrating are easily forgotten as I am always less than ten minutes away from most any part of College Station, including the Texas A&M campus.  I'll confess that the rate I pay to be at the intersection of "Texas and University" sometimes makes me feel downright criminal.

data.title: Clean Hotel
data.text: its having construction done ,so walking our service animals was a challenge . the room was clean and properly deodorized . plenty of towels decent wifi service and otherwise good overall place to stay while working

data.title: Needs renovation
data.text: This hotel feel more like a motel without interior halls and access.  Rooms were not clean and exterior was not well kept.  Staff, however, is very friendly and courteous.  Breakfast and other amenities were as you's expect for a lower end hotel under $80/night.

owner_response.author: LQ0539GM, General Manager at La Quinta Inn College Station, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for taking the time to leave a review. This is definitely not the kind of experience we want our guests to have. Rest assured your concerns will be shared with our Housekeeping and Maintenance staff.  I hope you will visit us again in the future. Chris AGM
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: it sucks
data.text: Need a lot of work and updated. Could replace the carpets. They are nasty. The bed spread smells like it is about 100 years old. The ac's leak to much and it is slip hazard. There is mold and mildew on the patio's.

owner_response.author: LQ0539GM, General Manager at La Quinta Inn College Station, responded to this review
owner_response.text: First, I would like to thank you for taking the time to leave a review. This is definitely not the kind of experience we want our guests to have. I'm so sorry about the issues you encountered. Rest assured your concerns will be shared with our staff. Thank you again for taking the time to review our property and I hope you will visit us again in the future and it will be a more memorable stay. Chris AGM
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Dirty bathroom
data.text: Average at best hotel room and the tub was dirty, with hair in it.  It made me glad I was staying there for only one night. And despite it being a non smoking room, it smelled like smoke.  Disappointing.

owner_response.author: LQ0539GM, General Manager at La Quinta Inn College Station, responded to this review
owner_response.text: First, I would like to thank you for taking the time to leave a review. This is definitely not the kind of experience we want our guests to have. I would like to apologize for the issues you encountered and rest assured I will be sure to speak with our housekeeping supervisor about your concerns. Thank you again for taking the time to review our property and I hope you will visit us again in the future and it will be a more memorable stay. Chris AGM
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Softball Hotel summer 2016
data.text:
My wife and kids arrived at this property on Saturday July 30th. I had a business meeting in Wisconsin and I was not able to meet them until Wednesday. Sunday morning at 1:30 am a man started banging on my families window and would not stop. My wife called the front desk numerous times and no one answered or returned her call.

My wife talked to the manager the next morning and he agreed to move her closer to our group but he wanted her to call him throughout the day to confirm availability of the new room.  I don't think that it is the job of a scared guest to call the hotel all day to get a safer room.

The front desk/security dropped the ball by not answering my wife's call. The manager needs to be more sensitive and show better customer service when dealing with customers complaints. 

The Air condition did not work properly and we sweat all night.

They have a nice pool and bar b q grills.

owner_response.author: LQ0539GM, Manager at La Quinta Inn College Station, responded to this review
owner_response.text: First, I would like to thank you for taking the time to leave a review. This is definitely not the kind of experience we want our guests to have. I'm so sorry about the issues you encountered. Rest assured your concerns have been shared with our staff. Thank you again for taking the time to review our property and I hope you will visit us again in the future and it will be a more memorable stay. Chris AGM
owner_response.title: Owner Response
